content: - 13 -  asset bubbles that took place in the United States in the decade starting about two decades   ago.  Conclusion  In closing, let me concede that it is easier to pose these questions than it is to   answer them definitively.  The issues are both deep and interesting.  Along with other   monetary policy issues, particularly the role of the lender of last resort in a world of   significant uncertainty, they deserve the attention the profession in both academic and  governmental institutions is, will be, and should be giving them.
